meanings.definition: The action of expelling someone from a property.
meanings.sent1: The eviction of the noisy neighbors brought peace to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The landlord had to go through the eviction process to remove the troublesome tenant.
meanings.sent3: During the eviction, the cat seemed to be the only one enjoying the chaos.
meanings.sent4: The eviction was like a storm sweeping through, clearing out all the unwanted clutter.
meanings.sent5: The eviction notice on the door served as a stark reminder of the consequences of not paying rent.

meanings.definition: The process of legally removing a tenant from a property.
meanings.sent1: After the eviction, the apartment was finally vacant for renovations.
meanings.sent2: The eviction took longer than expected due to legal complications.
meanings.sent3: The eviction paperwork was accidentally mixed up with the birthday invitations.
meanings.sent4: The eviction felt like a long journey through a maze of rules and regulations.
meanings.sent5: The eviction notice was like a ticking time bomb, counting down the days until departure.
